Sofyan Basir Bebas, Eni Saragih Pernah Ungkap Pertemuan Ini
05 Nov 2019, 01:10 by M Rosseno Aji, Endri Kurniawati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Penasehat hukum terdakwa perkara korupsi proyek PLTU Riau-1 Eni Saragih, Fadli Nasution mengatakan kliennya pernah melakukan sejumlah pertemuan dengan Direktur PT PLN Sofyan Basir yang divonis bebas di Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi Jakarta pada Senin, 4 November 2019. Kesaksian Eni bertemu Sofyan berkali-kali itu tak pernah dicabut dalam proses penyidikan maupun di persidangan. "Ya di luar rapat resmi DPR ya tentu biasa saja DPR bertemu dengan mitra kerja dalam rangka program," kata dia saat dihubungi, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Pertemuan-pertemuan itu disinggung dalam putusan untuk Wakil Ketua Komisi Energi DPR Eni Saragih yang dibacakan pada 1 Maret 2019. Selain bertemu Eni, Sofyan juga bertemu dengan pemilik saham Blackgold Natural Resources Ltd, Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo, dan mantan Sekretaris Jenderal Golkar Idrus Marham. Berikut adalah pertemuan-pertemuan Sofyan dan Eni:
1. Pertemuan di rumah Ketua DPR Setya Novanto 2016Eni memfasilitasi pertemuan antara Sofyan Basir dan Direktur Pengadaan Strategis II PLN Supangkat Iwan Santoso dengan Setya. Tuan rumah meminta proyek PLTGU III Jawa kepada Sofyan. Namun, Sofyan mengatakan sudah ada kandidat penggarap proyek itu, namun menawarkan proyek PLTU Riau yang belum ada penggarapnya.
2. Bertemu di kantor PLN, awal 2017. Eni memperkenalkan Kotjo kepada Sofyan. Eni mengatakan Kotjo adalah pengusaha yang siap menggarap proyek PLTU Riau-1. Menjawab itu, Sofyan meminta agar penawaran proyek diserahkan kepada Supangkat Iwan Santoso.
3. Eni, Kotjo, dan Sofyan kembali bertemu di kantor PLN pada Juli 2017. IwanSantoso juga hadir. Atas perintah Sofyan, Supangkat menjelaskan soal mekanisme pembangunan Independent Power Producer berdasarkan Peraturan Presiden Nomor 4 Tahun 2016 tentang percepatan pembangunan infrastruktur ketenagalistrikan.
4. Eni, Kotjo dan Sofyan Basir kembali bertemu di BRI Lounge, 2017. Sofyan mengatakan Kotjo akan mendapatkan proyek PLTU Riau-1 dengan skema penunjukan langsung. Anak perusahaan PLN yang nantinya akan masuk dalam konsorsium harus memiliki saham minimal 51 persen.
5. Sofyan, Eni, dan Kotjo, 14 September 2017 di Restoran Arkadia, Plaza Senayan, Jakarta Selatan. Eni meminta bantuan Sofyan supaya Kotjo bisa mendapatkan proyek PLTU Riau-1. “Lalu Sofyan Basir memerintahkan Iwan Santoso mengawasi proses kontrak proyek PLTU Riau-1,” kata hakim.
6. Sofyan, Eni, Kotjo dan Supangkat bertemu di Hotel Fairmont, Jakarta, 6 November 2017. Kotjo keberatan atas masa pengendalian PLTU Riau-1 oleh perusahaan yang diwakilinya. Kotjo meminta masa pengendalian selama 20 tahun, namun dalam kontrak awal dengan PLN hanya disebut 15 tahun.
7. Pertemuan Eni, Kotjo, Supangkat dan Sofyan pada 31 Mei 2018 di rumah Sofyan. Mereka masih membahas masa pengendalian PLTU Riau-1.
8. Pertemuan Eni, Kotjo, Supangkat dan Sofyan di rumah Sofyan pada 6 Juni 2018. Mantan Menteri Sosial Idrus Marham juga ikut hadir.
9. Pertemuan 3 Juli 2018 hanya dihadiri oleh Eni dan Sofyan di restoran House of Yuen Dining, Hotel Fairmont, Jakarta. Eni mengatakan kepada Sofyan agar kontrak kerja sama terkait PLTU Riau-1 harus jelas, sehingga perlu untuk finalisasi kesepakatan kembali dengan Kotjo.
Dalam putusan untuk Sofyan, hakim menyebut setelah pertemuan itu, Eni Saragih melaporkan hasil pertemuan itu kepada Idrus Marham serta menyampaikan akan adanya pembagian imbalan kepada Sofyan Basir setelah proses kesepakatan proyek PLTU Riau-1.
Percakapan antara Eni dan Idrus itu, terjadi sepuluh hari sebelum Eni bersama Kotjo dtangkap KPK dalam operasi tangkap tangan pada 13 Juli 2018. Kasus itu juga menyeret Idrus, dan Sofyan Basir sebagai tersangka keempat.
Hakim dalam pertimbangan vonis untuk Basir menyatakan pertemuan-pertemuan itu bukan atas kehendak mantan dirut BRI itu dan bukan karena pesanan dari Eni ataupun Kotjo. Menurut hakim, pertemuan itu dilakukan sehubungan dengan program percepatan proyek listrik nasional. Percepatan Proyek sudah sesuai dengan 8 Program Nasional yang diatur dalam Peraturan Presiden nomor 14 tahun 2017 tentang percepatan pembangunan infrastruktur ketenagalistrikan.
Apalagi, menurut Majelis Hakim, berdasarkan fakta persidangan diketahui selama pertemuan Sofyan selalu mengajak Supangkat karena dianggap paling paham mengenai proyek itu. Kehadiran Sofyan dinilai pasif dalam pertemuan-pertemuan itu. "Bukan keinginan terdakwa Sofyan Basir ataupun Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo,” kata hakim.
Semuanya sesuai proyek ketenagalistrikan yang merupakan program nasional dan berdasarkan Peraturan Presiden nomor 14 Tahun 2017 tentang percepatan pembanguan infrastruktur ketenagalistrikan. Majelis hakim yang diketuai Hariono menyatakan Sofyan tidak mengetahui bahwa telah terjadi suap antara sejumlah pihak itu dan tidak mengetahui penerimaan fee secara bertahap.
text:
Sofyan Basir Was Free, Eni Saragih Never Said This Meeting
05 Nov 2019, 01:10 by M Rosseno Aji, Endri Kurniawati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The legal advisor of the Riau-1 PLTU Eni Saragih corruption project, Fadli Nasution said his client had held a number of meetings with PT PLN Director Sofyan Basir who was acquitted in the Jakarta Corruption Court on Monday, November 4, 2019. Testimony Eni met Sofyan many times and was never revoked during the investigation or trial process. "Yes, outside the official DPR meeting, of course it is normal for the DPR to meet with partners in the framework of the program," he said when contacted on Monday, November 4, 2019.
The meetings were alluded to in the verdict for the Deputy Chairperson of the DPR Energy Commission Eni Saragih read out on March 1, 2019. In addition to meeting Eni, Sofyan also met with Blackgold Natural Resources Ltd shareholder Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo, and former Golkar Secretary General Idrus Marham. Following are the Sofyan and Eni meetings:
1. Meeting at the house of House Speaker Setya Novanto 2016Eni facilitated a meeting between Sofyan Basir and PLN's Strategic Procurement Director II Supangkat Iwan Santoso and Setya. The host asked Sofyan for the PLTGU III project. However, Sofyan said there were already candidates for the project, but offered the Riau PLTU project that had not yet been cultivated.
2. Meeting at the PLN office, early 2017. Eni introduces Kotjo to Sofyan. Eni said that Kotjo is a businessman who is ready to work on the Riau-1 PLTU project. Answering that, Sofyan requested that the project offer be submitted to Supangkat Iwan Santoso.
3. Eni, Kotjo and Sofyan meet again at the PLN office in July 2017. Iwan Santoso was also present. On the orders of Sofyan, Supangkat explained the mechanism of Independent Power Producer development based on Presidential Regulation No. 4 of 2016 concerning the acceleration of electricity infrastructure development.
4. Eni, Kotjo and Sofyan Basir meet again at BRI Lounge, 2017. Sofyan said that Kotjo will get the Riau-1 PLTU project with a direct appointment scheme. PLN's subsidiary which will later enter the consortium must have a minimum share of 51 percent.
5. Sofyan, Eni, and Kotjo, 14 September 2017 at Arkadia Restaurant, Plaza Senayan, South Jakarta. Eni asked Sofyan for help so that Kotjo could get the Riau-1 PLTU project. "Then Sofyan Basir ordered Iwan Santoso to oversee the contracting process of the Riau-1 PLTU project," the judge said.
6. Sofyan, Eni, Kotjo and Supangkat met at the Fairmont Hotel, Jakarta, November 6, 2017. Kotjo objected to the controlling period of the Riau-1 power plant by the company he represented. Kotjo requested a control period of 20 years, but in the initial contract with PLN it was only called 15 years.
7. Meeting Eni, Kotjo, Supangkat and Sofyan on May 31, 2018 at Sofyan's home. They are still discussing the Riau-1 PLTU control period.
8. Meeting Eni, Kotjo, Supangkat and Sofyan at Sofyan's home on 6 June 2018. Former Social Minister Idrus Marham was also present.
9. The 3rd July 2018 meeting was only attended by Eni and Sofyan at the House of Yuen Dining restaurant, Fairmont Hotel, Jakarta. Eni told Sofyan that the cooperation contract related to the Riau-1 PLTU must be clear, so it was necessary to finalize the agreement again with Kotjo.
In the verdict for Sofyan, the judge said after the meeting, Eni Saragih reported the results of the meeting to Idrus Marham and said there would be a reward distribution to Sofyan Basir after the Riau-1 PLTU project agreement process.
The conversation between Eni and Idrus occurred ten days before Eni and Kotjo were arrested by the KPK during a hand-arrest operation on July 13, 2018. The case also dragged Idrus, and Sofyan Basir as the fourth suspect.
The judge in consideration of the verdict for Basir stated that the meetings were not at the will of the former BRI president director and not because of an order from Eni or Kotjo. According to the judge, the meeting was held in connection with the national electricity project acceleration program. Project Acceleration is in accordance with 8 National Programs that are regulated in Presidential Regulation number 14 of 2017 concerning the acceleration of electricity infrastructure development.
Moreover, according to the Panel of Judges, based on the facts of the trial it was known that during the meeting Sofyan always invited Supangkat because he was considered to be the most understanding about the project. Sofyan's presence was considered passive at the meetings. "It is not the desire of the defendant Sofyan Basir or Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo," the judge said.
Everything is in accordance with the electricity project which is a national program and based on Presidential Regulation number 14 of 2017 concerning the acceleration of electricity infrastructure development. The panel of judges chaired by Hariono stated Sofyan did not know that bribes had taken place between the parties and did not know the fee received in stages.
